answers.answer: Yep it's happened to me when I get warm, am hungry, or thirsty. We have to listen to our bodies & take it easy. I carry frozen water with me & snacks because it's not fun losing your vision.

It happens to me every now and then. My blood sugar gows down and I get the exact symptoms. I dont have any problems at all with my blood sugar levels but my Dr said that can happen sometimes either if i don't  eat, or if I eat too much in a short period of times.It's  hotrible because I even beging sweating cold and I cant hear well for a few seconds.
I started crying cause I didn't know what in the hell was going on. My father in law picked me up and took me home, cause my boss didn't want me driving

It's ok mommy. I was checked for diabetes twice & it was fine but I am on iron pills. At 27 weeks I'm sure they've checked your levels by now. Eating more protein foods rather than sugary foods does help though.

I've been like that my entire pregnancy. Im a project manager and had to stop working at 25weeks. I would just sit any where because felt like i was about to faint. My doctor ran all test iron, thyroid all is ok just part of my pregnancy. For ur job sake i hope it goes away with eating or just drinking more water. Good luck dear

question: I'm 27 weeks... was at work (I'm a cashier) I became dizzy, heart was racing,  my vision was blurry for a moment and I felt nauseous. After speaking to my doctor I went home ate a little bit and rested. I feel better now. Just curious if anyone else has felt this way?
title: wanting to know if you experienced this
